Description: Bronze axe-head: with rounded blade and angular lugs . The central hole is larger than the two lateral and is not properly aligned with them. The blade is thickly corroded and the cutting edge damaged through use. Traces of the wooden haft survive along the butt, and remains of the original binding are preserved in one of the lateral holes.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (36)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
